item.title: Bonnaz Embroidery
item.description: Ruth Franklin covers everything from machine operation, troubleshooting machine problems, industry professionalism to pricing embroidery work. Every page contains details regarding bonnaz embroidery and comes with the authority and experience of a 40+ year veteran. It is highly recommended that all chain stitch operators have a printed copy of this book to reference. Extra effort was taken when digitizing the original documents to allow for searchable keywords and phrase matches. For example searching for Cornely looper timing or inconsistent stitch issues can be found with “looper” or “timing”.

item.title: Ruth Franklin's Instructional Videos
item.description: The Artistic Touch School of Embroidery Videos give all of the information needed to learn to operate a chain stitch embroidery machine. Volume 1 includes Ruth Franklin instructing her student Leah through the embroidery operation basics. Volumes 2 and 3 include Ruth Franklin demonstrating more advanced techniques. All together they cover everything that was taught to her students in person. The full 4 hours of instructional videos can be found below.

item.title: The Artistic Touch Lettering Book
item.description: The Lettering Book contains lettering styles, placement, templating examples and clip art all accumulated by Ruth during her 40yrs of running an embroidery art business. Volume 3 of her VHS tape series gives a tutorial on how to embroider designs directly from this very lettering book. The archival scan of this lettering book allow for search terms on your phone or computer and is meant to be printed for manual layouts of lettering.

item.title: The Monogram Design Book
item.description: The Monogram Design Book is 277 pages and covers monograms on the Singer 114w103 but is applicable to all universal feed bonnaz chain stitch embroidery machine. This book goes over the basics of monogram application, sizing and pricing. It also contains a few hundred design examples and alphabets to reference. Volume 3 of her VHS tape series gives a tutorial on how to embroider designs directly from the monogram book.

item.title: About
item.description: This site is maintained by Noah Johnson of Stitch-Rite Embroidery Service The materials and content on this website were scanned and curated to be a free reference for the bonnaz embroidery community. All of the Artistic Touch publications found here are still under copyright. Please feel free to download and print any of the documents for your personal use only. The books were archived at a 600dpi high resolution and processed to be searchable via text input.

item.title: Bonnie Williams
item.description: Trained By Ruth Franklin This site would not be possible without the generosity of Bonnie Williams and her 40 years of dedicated work in the embroidery industry. Bonnie met Ruth Franklin in 1979 and spent time learning to operate the Singer 114w103 bonnaz machine under Ruth’s supervision. A full machine disassembly, hours of embroidering squares to learn how to get sharp corners, Ruth ensured that Bonnie would become a skilled operator.
